essential.description: Must-have tools for any developer - auto-installed without prompting

version_managers.description: Language version managers - recommended over Homebrew language installations

uv.reason: Modern unified Python toolkit by Astral (Ruff creators). Combines Python version management, dependency resolution, virtual environments, and package management in one blazingly fast tool. 10-100x faster than pip, downloads pre-built binaries (no compilation). Replaces pip, pipx, pyenv, virtualenv, and pip-tools.
post_install: Set project Python: uv python pin 3.12
Install CLI tools: uv tool install ruff
benefits: Cross-platform lockfiles (develop on Mac, deploy on Linux)
Drop-in pip replacement (uv pip install works the same)

pyenv.reason: Established Python version manager. Mature and stable, but only handles version management. Requires separate tools for dependencies (pip, poetry) and compiles Python from source (slow).

nvm.reason: Most popular Node.js version manager with largest community support.

modern_alternatives.fnm: Rust-based, 40x faster than nvm, same commands
modern_alternatives.volta: Automatic version switching based on project, best for teams

post_install: Set default: nvm alias default lts/*

rbenv.reason: Lightweight, transparent Ruby version manager. Non-intrusive (doesn't override shell commands like RVM).

tfenv.reason: Essential for Terraform version management. Terraform changed to BSL license and is deprecated in Homebrew. Use tfenv + OpenTofu (open-source fork).

languages.description: Programming language runtimes - prompt user with version manager recommendations

openjdk.prompt: Install OpenJDK as system fallback Java?
openjdk.note: SDKMAN already handles Java versions. This is just a system fallback.

perl.note: Keep - often required by system tools and build scripts

go_official.reason: Official Go installer at /usr/local/go is preferred. Use gvm only if you need multiple versions.

cloud_devops.description: Cloud platforms and DevOps automation tools

build_tools.description: Compilers, build systems, and development libraries
build_tools.prompt: Install build tools for compiling from source?
build_tools.note: Essential if you compile software from source or work with C/C++ projects

cli_productivity.description: Modern CLI tools to enhance terminal productivity

eza.description: Modern ls replacement with colors, icons, Git integration

fd.description: Simple, fast alternative to find command

httpie.description: User-friendly HTTP client with intuitive syntax

delta.description: Better git diff with syntax highlighting

fzf.description: Fuzzy finder for command history, files, etc.

zoxide.description: Smart cd that learns your habits

procs.description: Modern ps replacement with better output

database_clients.description: Database client libraries and CLI tools (not servers)
database_clients.note: These are client tools only. Install actual database servers separately or via Docker.

media_processing.description: Image, video, and audio processing tools
media_processing.prompt: Do you work with media files (images, video, audio)?
media_processing.note: FFmpeg and codecs are large. Only install if you process multimedia.

compression_libs.note: These are dependencies. Homebrew installs them automatically when needed.

networking_security.description: Networking and security libraries (auto-installed as dependencies)
networking_security.note: Essential security libraries. Installed automatically as dependencies.

development_libs.description: Development libraries for graphics, XML, math, etc.
development_libs.note: 80+ libraries. Homebrew manages these as dependencies automatically.

deprecated.description: Packages that should not be installed

python@2.reason: End of life since January 2020. Security risk.

terraform.reason: Deprecated in Homebrew due to BSL license change

python@3.11.reason: Use pyenv for version management instead

python@3.12.reason: Use pyenv for version management instead

python@3.13.reason: Use pyenv for version management instead

python@3.14.reason: Use pyenv for version management instead

node.reason: Use nvm/fnm/volta for version management instead

casks.prompt: Install GUI applications via Homebrew Cask?
casks.note: Casks are personal preference. Select what you actually use.

modern_alternatives.description: Suggested modern replacements for traditional Unix tools

replacements.reason: Colors, icons, Git integration, tree view
Syntax highlighting, Git integration, line numbers
Learns your habits, jump to frequent directories
